greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle array read by rows: a(0,0) = 2 and for n>=1, 0<=m<=n, a(n,m) = binomial(2*n-m,m)*(n-m)!*2*n/(2*n-m).
comment: For n>=1, o.g.f. of n-th row is a polynomial p(x,n) = Sum_{m=0..n} x^m * binomial(2*n - m, m) * (n - m)! * 2 * n / (2*n - m). These polynomials are hit polynomials for the reduced ménage problem (Riordan 1958).
reference: J. Riordan, An Introduction to Combinatorial Analysis, Wiley, 1958, pp. 197-199
mathematica: Table[CoefficientList[If[n == 0, 2, Sum[Binomial[2*n - m, m]*(n - m)!*( 2*n/(2*n - m))x^m, {m, 0, n}]], x], {n, 0, 12}];
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Feb 20 2009
ext: Edited and changed a(0,0)=2 (to make formula continuous and constant along the diagonal n=m) by _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 06 2018
